content:
I want to prove the relationship between rank and the solution ,but I got error typeclass instance problem is stuck, it is often due to metavariables Inhabited ?m.12356 at theorem unique_solution_iff_rank_eq,I don't know why the type cann't defined.When I move the cursor to the last augementMatrix ,the inforiew display
**R** : Type u **inst✝¹** : LinearOrderedField R **inst✝** : Inhabited R **m** : ℕ **hm** : m > 0 **coefficientMatrix** : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m) R **rMatrix** : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin 1) R **augementMatrix** : optParam (Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m.succ) R) (augmented_matrix hm coefficientMatrix rMatrix) **⊢** Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m) ?m.12356,but I have specified the type as Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m.succ) R in the parameters. Because the code is quite long, only a part was pasted. I'm very sorry. Do you need me to provide the complete code? Thanks very much!

import Mathlib
namespace Matrix
universe u
variable {R : Type u}
open Matrix
def row_index_col_max_abs_arg [LinearOrderedField R] {m n : ℕ } (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R) (i : Fin m ) (j : Fin n ) :Option (Fin m)  := sorry
def row_update_by_eleRowAdd [Field R] {m n : ℕ } (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R) (i : Fin m ) (ti : Fin m) (hi': ti < i) (k : Fin n) : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R := sorry
def elimination_loop [LinearOrderedField R]  [Inhabited R] {m n : ℕ } (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R) (h : Fin m) (k: Fin n ) : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R :=
 sorry
def Gaussian_elimination  [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m n : ℕ } (hm : m > 0) (hn : n > 0) (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R): Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R :=
  let h : Fin m := Fin.mk (0) hm /-Initialization of the pivot row-/
  let k : Fin n:= Fin.mk (0) hn /-Initialization of the pivot column -/
  elimination_loop A h k
def row_echelon_form_from_Gaussian_eli [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m n : ℕ } (hm : m > 0) (hn : n > 0) (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R): Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R := Gaussian_elimination hm hn A

def backwards_row_update [Field R] {m n : ℕ } (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R) (hm : m > 0) (hn : n > 0)(i : Fin m) (ti : Fin m) (k : Fin n): Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R :=
 sorry
def Jordan_elimination_loop [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m n : ℕ } (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R) (hm: m>0) (hn:n>0) (h : Fin m) (k: Fin n ) (hh : h< m) (hk : k<n): Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R :=
 sorry
def GaussJordan_elimination [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m n : ℕ } (hm : m > 0) (hn : n > 0) (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R): Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R :=
 sorry
def reduced_echelon_form_from_GaussJordan_eli [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m n : ℕ } (hm : m > 0) (hn : n > 0) (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R): Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R := GaussJordan_elimination hm hn A

def augmented_matrix [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m : ℕ } (hm : m > 0) (coefficientMatrix : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m) R) (rMatrix : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin 1) R): Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m.succ) R :=
  Matrix.of (fun i j =>
    if h : j.val < m then
      (coefficientMatrix i ⟨j.val, h⟩ :R) -- ⟨j.val, h⟩ : Fin m
    else
      (rMatrix i 0 : R))


section rank_of_matrix
def num_of_nonezero_row [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m n : ℕ }  (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R) : ℕ :=
  let rows := List.ofFn (fun i : (Fin m) => A i)
  (rows.filter (fun row => ∃ j, row j ≠ 0)).length
#eval num_of_nonezero_row (reduced_echelon_form_from_GaussJordan_eli  (hm := by linarith) (hn := by linarith) m) -- 2 ( -- !![2, 0, -2; 0, 1, 1; 0, 0, 0])

def rank_from_row_echelon_form [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m n : ℕ } (hm : m > 0) (hn : n > 0) (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R): ℕ :=
  let reducedA : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R  :=reduced_echelon_form_from_GaussJordan_eli hm hn A
  num_of_nonezero_row reducedA
def rank [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m n : ℕ } (hm : m > 0) (hn : n > 0) (A : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin n) R): ℕ := rank_from_row_echelon_form hm hn A

#check Matrix.mulVec
def solution_exists [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m : ℕ } (coefficientMatrix : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m) R) (rMatrix : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin 1) R): Prop :=
   ∃ x : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin 1) R, coefficientMatrix * x= rMatrix

def has_unique_solution [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m : ℕ } (coefficientMatrix : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m) R) (rMatrix : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin 1) R): Prop :=
   ∃! x : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin 1) R, coefficientMatrix * x= rMatrix


/-error : typeclass instance problem is stuck, it is often due to metavariables
  Inhabited ?m.12356-/
theorem unique_solution_iff_rank_eq [LinearOrderedField R] [Inhabited R] {m : ℕ } (hm : m > 0) (coefficientMatrix : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m) R) (rMatrix : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin 1) R) (augementMatrix : Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m.succ) R := augmented_matrix hm coefficientMatrix rMatrix): has_unique_solution coefficientMatrix rMatrix ↔ (rank_from_row_echelon_form hm hm augementMatrix) =  (rank_from_row_echelon_form hm hm coefficientMatrix) :=by
  sorry

(previous guess deleted): I deleted all the Inhabited instances as they're not necessary (Lean knows that fields are inhabited) and the actual reason for the mismatch is

application type mismatch
  rank_from_row_echelon_form hm hm augementMatrix
argument
  augementMatrix
has type
  Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m.succ) R : Type u
but is expected to have type
  Matrix (Fin m) (Fin m) ?m.67505 : Type u
Alex has marked this topic as resolved.
